vehicles.description: A black sedan with its trunk open, stopped on the right side of the ego vehicle
vehicles.explanation: This vehicle is partially obstructing the lane and could start moving unexpectedly, requiring the ego vehicle to keep a safe distance and be prepared to adjust speed or change lanes.

vehicles.description: A silver car parked on the side under the overpass in the distance
vehicles.explanation: The parked vehicle poses no immediate threat but is a reminder to stay alert for potential doors opening or pedestrians stepping out from parked cars.

vulnerable_road_users.description: A cyclist on the same side of the road as the ego vehicle, travelling in the same direction
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: The cyclist is a vulnerable road user and requires the ego vehicle to provide sufficient clearance when passing and to monitor for any sudden changes in the cyclist's path.

vulnerable_road_users.description: Pedestrians crossing the road at a zebra crossing in front of a green light ahead of the ego vehicle
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: These pedestrians have right of way and the green traffic signal applies to them; the ego vehicle must yield until the crosswalk is clear.

traffic signs.description: A speed limit sign indicating a maximum of 40 km/h to the right of the traffic lights
traffic signs.explanation: This sign sets the speed limit for the area, suggesting that the ego vehicle should ensure its speed does not exceed this limit.

traffic signs.description: A pedestrian crosswalk sign next to the speed limit sign
traffic signs.explanation: This indicates there is a pedestrian crossing ahead, alerting the ego vehicle to be cautious of pedestrians and prepared to stop.

traffic lights.description: Traffic lights showing green for going straight and red for turning right
traffic lights.explanation: This indicates that the ego vehicle is allowed to move forward but not turn right at the intersection.

traffic cones.description: Red and white traffic cones placed on the left side of the ego vehicle
traffic cones.explanation: These cones are demarcating a construction zone or road closure and require the ego vehicle to stay within the limits of the open lane.

barriers.description: Red and white striped barriers under the overpass on the right
barriers.explanation: These barriers are marking off a restricted or construction area, indicating that the ego vehicle should not cross into that area.

general_perception.description and explanation:
The image shows various road users and objects that influence the driving behavior of the ego vehicle. 

There are two vehicles present: 
1. A black sedan with its trunk open, stopped on the right side of the ego vehicle. This vehicle is partially obstructing the lane and could start moving unexpectedly, requiring the ego vehicle to keep a safe distance and be prepared to adjust speed or change lanes.
2. A silver car parked on the side under the overpass in the distance. Although it poses no immediate threat, it serves as a reminder to stay alert for potential doors opening or pedestrians stepping out from parked cars.

There are also two vulnerable road users:
1. A cyclist on the same side of the road as the ego vehicle, traveling in the same direction. This cyclist requires the ego vehicle to provide sufficient clearance when passing and to monitor for any sudden changes in the cyclist's path.
2. Pedestrians crossing the road at a zebra crossing in front of a green light ahead of the ego vehicle. These pedestrians have the right of way, and the green traffic signal applies to them; thus, the ego vehicle must yield until the crosswalk is clear.

Regarding traffic signs:
1. A speed limit sign indicates a maximum of 40 km/h to the right of the traffic lights. This sets the speed limit for the area, suggesting that the ego vehicle should ensure its speed does not exceed this limit.
2. A pedestrian crosswalk sign next to the speed limit sign indicates there is a pedestrian crossing ahead, alerting the ego vehicle to be cautious of pedestrians and prepared to stop.

The traffic lights show green for going straight and red for turning right, indicating that the ego vehicle is allowed to move forward but not turn right at the intersection.

Red and white traffic cones are placed on the left side of the ego vehicle, demarcating a construction zone or road closure, requiring the ego vehicle to stay within the limits of the open lane.

Lastly, there are red and white striped barriers under the overpass on the right. These barriers mark off a restricted or construction area, indicating that the ego vehicle should not cross into that area.

1.description and explanation: This is a red plastic barrier, often used in construction zones or road work areas to signal drivers about hazardous conditions or areas where caution is required. It delineates the boundary of the work area or closed section of the road to prevent unauthorized access and maintain traffic safety. For the ego vehicle, this means that it should remain within the designated traffic lanes and adjust speed as per any associated signage or general safety practices in construction zones.

2.description and explanation: The object is a moped, a small, two-wheeled motorized vehicle commonly used for short distances and easy navigation through traffic. Mopeds can abruptly alter speed or direction, influencing the ego vehicle to maintain a safe following distance and be prepared for sudden stops or shifts in the moped's trajectory.

3.description and explanation: Identified as a cart, typically utilized to transport goods in urban and semi-urban areas. Carts move slower than motorized vehicles and can often stop without warning to load or unload. Drivers in the ego vehicle need to practice caution by reducing speed and ensuring a safe passing distance to avoid collision, especially near market or densely populated areas.

driving_suggestion: The ego vehicle should proceed straight respecting the green traffic signal, maintain a speed not exceeding 40 km/h, and be prepared to stop for pedestrians at the crosswalk. It should give wide berth to the cyclist and be cautious of the black sedan with the trunk open. The ego vehicle should stay within the limits of the traffic cones and avoid the construction area marked by the barriers.
